title: Graham–Pollak theorem
summary: In graph theory, the Graham–Pollak theorem states that the edges of an n {\displaystyle n} -vertex complete graph cannot be partitioned into fewer than n − 1 {\displaystyle n-1} complete bipartite graphs.[1] It was first published by Ronald Graham and Henry O. Pollak in two papers in 1971 and 1972, in connection with an application to telephone switching circuitry.[2][3]
